revisions.rev:
{{Infobox_Company | company_name = Fox International Channels | company_logo = [[Image:FIC Logo.svg|250px|Official FIC Logo]] | caption = | company_type = [[Subsidiary]] of [[Fox Entertainment Group]] | foundation = 1993 | location = | key_people = | industry = [[Television]] | products = [[Television program]]s | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | owner = [[News Corporation]] | num_employees = | parent = [[Fox Entertainment Group]] | homepage = [http://www.foxinternationalchannels.com foxinternationalchannels.com] }} '''Fox International Channels''' (FIC) is a subsidiary of the [[Fox Entertainment Group]], which is a part of [[Rupert Murdoch]]'s global media conglomerate [[News Corporation]]. It produces and distributes entertainment, factual, sports, and movie channels through television channels in Europe, Africa, Asia and Latin America using several brands, including [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]], [[FX]], [[Fox Crime]], [[Fox Life]], [[National Geographic Channel]], [[STAR TV (Asia)|STAR TV]] and [[Baby TV]].
== Fox International Channels in Asia == FIC Asia was developed into a regional division in 1993 with the launch of the Fox-branded general entertainment channel in Japan. It currently operates several active channel brands in Asia, including National Geographic Channel and its associated channels, FX, Fox, Fox Crime, Fox Movies, STAR World, Star Movies, tvN, Channel V and Baby TV. All of them are in their local languages and programmed independently for each market. It broadcasts into over 110 million homes in Asia.
==Channels== This is an incomplete list of channels operated by Fox International Channels.

*[[XYZnetworks]] (12.5%) - joint venture between [[Foxtel]] and [[Austar]] **[[Arena (TV network)|Arena]] (which has a 2 hour timeshift channel) **[[The LifeStyle Channel]] (which has a HD simulcast and a 2 hour timeshift channel) **[[LifeStyle Food]] (which has a 2 hour timeshift channel) **[[LifeStyle Home]] **[[LifeStyle You]] (which has a 2 hour timeshift channel) **[[The Weather Channel (Australia)|The Weather Channel]] **[[Nickelodeon (Australia)|Nickelodeon Australia]] (35%) - joint venture with [[Viacom]] (65%) **[[Nick Jr. (Australia)|Nick Jr.]] (35%) - joint venture with [[Viacom]] (65%) **[[Channel V Australia]] **[[V Hits]] **[[Max (channel)|Max]] **[[Country Music Channel]]
